official-title.#text:
To allow reviews of certain families’ incomes every 3 years for purposes of determining eligibility
			 for certain Federal assisted housing programs.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Tenant Income Verification Relief Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tenant Income Verification Relief Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#text:
; except that, in the case of any family with a fixed income, as defined by the Secretary, after
			 the initial review of the family’s income, the public housing agency or
			 owner shall not be required to conduct a review of the family’s income for
			 any year for which such family certifies, in accordance with such
			 requirements as the Secretary shall establish, which shall include
			 policies to adjust for inflation-based income changes, that 90 percent or
			 more of the income of the family consists of fixed income, and that the
			 sources of such income have not changed since the previous year, except
			 that the public housing agency or owner shall conduct a review of each
			 such family’s income not less than once every 3 years
